channel.title: Scar random procedure
channel.description:
Basicly i need scar to randomly pick 1 out of 10 choices, either click on stats..then hover on def exp...open sac...etc
so any help D:

item.title: Scar random procedure
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:6, topic:100523”]Try adding in some anti-ban now. Try to think what you would do when you get bored of all that playing, and implement that into a procedure.

I just learned how to use ‘Case’ yesterday, and that comes in handy. It will make all of your methods even more random and human-like. Ex:

Procedure RandomMouse
var move, number:Integer;
begin
move:=1;
  repeat
  number:=1;
    case Random(3) of
      0: begin
         move:=move+1;
         number:=number+random(2);
           if(number=1)then
             Mouse(240+random(30),240+random(30),1,1,true);
           if(number=2)then
             Mouse(240-random(30),240-random(30),1,1,true);
         end;

      1: begin
         move:=move+1;
         number:=number+random(2);
           if(number=1)then
             Mouse(240+random(30),240+random(30),1,1,true);
           if(number=2)then
             Mouse(240-random(30),240-random(30),1,1,true);
         end;

      2: begin
           MMouse (0 +random(15),0 +random(15),1,1);
           Wait(250)
         end;
    end;
  until(move=3)
end;

basically it just picks (at random) one of those, and does it. I made it repeat, until it clicked in two different places by making the Move:=move+1 until =3.

Don’t use that in Runescape though, because you don’t want scar clicking random places on your screen. Thats when you would use MMouse or hoverskill(attack) etc.[/quote]

I didn’t feel like typing it all out again
Just make the random(3) to the number of choices you have (10 in your case).

and dont use my repeat / until(move=3). Just call up that procedure every few minutes.

Read full topic
